pronunciation: EFFEM'INATE, [Latin effoeminatus, from effoeminor, to grow or make womanish, from foemina, a woman. See Woman.]

definitions.text:
Effeminate
1. Having the qualities of the female sex; soft delicate unmanly degree; tender; womanish; voluptuous.The king, by his voluptuous life and mean marriage, became effeminate and less sensible of honor.
2. Womanish; weak; resembling the practice qualities of the sex; as effeminate peace; effeminate life.
3. Womanlike, tender, sense not reproachful.EFFEM'INATE,
To womanish; unman; weaken; as effeminate children.EFFEM'INATE,
To weak; melt into weakness.In slothful peace courage will effeminate
